nodes.name: Leadership
nodes.description: The act of guiding individuals or groups toward shared goals through influence, motivation, and direction.

nodes.name: Stakeholder Engagement
nodes.description: Process of communicating and working with stakeholders to meet their needs and expectations.

nodes.name: Team Development
nodes.description: Building and maintaining high-performing project teams through coaching, mentoring, and empowerment.

nodes.name: Conflict Resolution
nodes.description: Addressing and resolving disagreements within the team or with stakeholders constructively.

nodes.name: Servant Leadership
nodes.description: Leadership style focused on serving the team by removing obstacles and enabling high performance.

nodes.name: Project Scope
nodes.description: The boundaries of what is included and excluded from a project, defining deliverables and work required.

nodes.name: Work Breakdown Structure
nodes.description: Hierarchical decomposition of project deliverables into manageable work packages.

nodes.name: Critical Path Method
nodes.description: Technique for determining project duration by identifying the longest sequence of dependent activities.

nodes.name: Risk Management
nodes.description: Identifying, assessing, and responding to project risks to minimize threats and maximize opportunities.

nodes.name: Quality Management
nodes.description: Processes and activities to ensure project deliverables meet requirements and expectations.

nodes.name: Agile Methodology
nodes.description: Iterative approach to project management emphasizing flexibility, customer collaboration, and rapid delivery.

nodes.name: Change Management
nodes.description: Structured approach to transitioning individuals, teams, and organizations to a desired future state.

nodes.name: Procurement Management
nodes.description: Processes for acquiring products, services, or results from outside the project team.

nodes.name: Strategic Alignment
nodes.description: Ensuring project outcomes align with organizational strategy and business objectives.

nodes.name: Business Value
nodes.description: The worth of a project in terms of benefits, costs, and risks to the organization.

nodes.name: Governance
nodes.description: Framework of rules, practices, and processes used to direct and control projects.

nodes.name: Compliance
nodes.description: Adhering to laws, regulations, standards, and organizational policies affecting the project.

nodes.name: Sustainability
nodes.description: Considering environmental, social, and economic factors in project decisions and outcomes.

nodes.name: Communication Management
nodes.description: Processes for timely and appropriate generation, collection, dissemination, and storage of project information.

nodes.name: Knowledge Management
nodes.description: Processes for creating, sharing, using, and managing project knowledge and lessons learned.

nodes.name: Resource Management
nodes.description: Identifying, acquiring, and managing resources needed for successful project completion.

nodes.name: Monitoring and Controlling
nodes.description: Tracking project progress, comparing to plan, and taking corrective action as needed.

nodes.name: Requirements Management
nodes.description: Processes for collecting, analyzing, and documenting stakeholder requirements and expectations.

nodes.name: Organizational Culture
nodes.description: The shared values, beliefs, and behaviors that influence how work gets done in an organization.

nodes.name: Benefits Realization
nodes.description: Ensuring planned benefits from a project are achieved and sustained after project completion.

nodes.name: Hybrid Approach
nodes.description: Combining predictive and adaptive methodologies to suit project characteristics and stakeholder needs.
